subsections.description: After opening the Doorway to Nowhere, Pack-a-Punch will start in the Dark Aether Nexus. Throughout the game, the PaP machine will teleport between the Dark Aether Nexus and the Dig Site (spawn).

pic.alt: Ritual Bowl to place Amulet to open the Doorway to Nowhere

subsections.description: Fungus will grow around the Dark Aether Nexus and can grow between 3 stages. Destroying fungus will drop Salvage, but you can also use them to summon creatures for additional loot. Hold the melee button (or spam it) on the fungus until it bursts. This will destroy the fungus and drop the Salvage as usual, but will also make 2 creatures quickly try to fly away. Killing the creatures will drop extra loot, and the rarity of the loot depends on the level of fungus and color of the creature.
All around the map there are small piles of dirt and skulls that you can dig for rewards. Each player must first find a shovel around the map, then they can dig unlimited piles.

pic.alt: Shovel location 1 - near Death Perception, up on some rubble
Shovel location 2 - between Speed Cola and the Green Gateway
Shovel location 3 - down the stairs from the Red Gateway, behind a wall
Shovel location 4 - next to Quick Revive

subsections.description: The dark aether crystals around the map can be broken to drop random loot, including Salvage.
The radio and exfil location are both in the Dig Site.
Located near Quick Revive in the Subterranean Temple.

pic.alt: PhD Flopper - in the Dig Site (through the Blue Gateway)
Deadshot Daiquiri - between spawn and Speed Cola
Speed Cola - through the Green Gateway
Quick Revive - through the Red Gateway
Death Perception - between spawn and Stamin-Up
Juggernog - in the Dark Aether Nexus, by the Yellow Gateway
Der Wunderfizz - in the Dark Aether Nexus, by the Green Gateway (spawns at the start of round 25)

sections.description: Collect 3 parts, then defend the Staff.

subsections.description: Dropped when killing the first Shock Mimic on round 8.

Parts 2 and 3 can be collected in any order. Break Aetheric Lanterns in the Tombs until symbols are revealed. When the lantern appears in the correct location, and the Monocle part has been aquired, several symbols will appear on the wall over a mural. Shoot the symbols in ascending order (each symbol represents a Roman Numeral counting from 1 to 8). Finally, kill the creatures emerging from the portals until the part appears by the mural.

Parts 2 and 3 can be collected in any order. Break Aetheric Lanterns in the Neolithic Catacombs until symbols are revealed. When the lantern appears in the correct location, and the Monocle part has been aquired, several symbols will appear on the wall over a mural. Shoot the symbols in ascending order (each symbol represents a Roman Numeral counting from 1 to 10). Finally, kill the creatures emerging from the portals until the part appears by the mural.

Activate the Staff of Ice pieces on the Plinth in the Dark Aether. Then, defend the Staff of Ice until it's assembled. If you fail, you can try again the following round. One player may now retrieve the Staff of Ice.

sections.description: The upgrade process must be done once, then all players may upgrade their Staff of Ice.

subsections.description: Freeze 3 Aetheric Lanterns with the Staff of Ice within 10 seconds. A simple strategy involves using a different weapon to shoot the lanterns in the Ossuary and the Shrine of the Hierophants until they're visible through the doors from the Subterranean Temple. Then, shoot the lantern in the Subterranean Temple until it's near one of the doors, such that all 3 are lined up and can be shot quickly in a row. When done successfully, Archibald will speak, and the symbols for the next step will appear.

subsections.header: 2. Shoot 3 Runes in the Dark Aether Nexus
subsections.description: With the Staff of Ice, shoot 3 Runes on the floating rocks in the Dark Aether sky. After each symbol has been shot, the rock will lower closer to the ground. When all 3 rocks have been lowered, memorize the 3 symbols for the next step. The symbols and locations of the rocks are randomized each game.

pic.alt: Floating rock with a purple Rune

subsections.description: One of the Gateways will now be closed on both sides. Exit the Dark Aether Nexus and locate the Gateway that has been closed. The Gateway will be covered in various symbols, including the 3 from the previous step. Use the Staff of Ice to shoot the same Runes on the outside Gateway and enter it. If the wrong symbols were shot, you will appear in the sky and take heavy fall damage. When done successfully, you will appear on a floating rock next to a purple orb. Interact to touch the Energy and begin the next step.

The purple orb will slowly move around the Dark Aether Nexus and can be fed by killing enemies. Stay close to the Energy as it moves around the Dark Aether. All players should stay as close to the Energy as possible and constantly killing enemies, or the step will fail. If the step fails, you must repeat the previous step to teleport to the Energy. If the Energy reaches the Plinth, the step will be completed.

pic.alt: Following the Energy to feed it zombies

subsections.header: 5. Touch the Staff to the Altar
subsections.description: Interact on the glowing purple energy to upgrade the Staff of Ice into the Ull's Arrow. Each time a staff is upgraded, the Altar must recharge before it can be used again to upgrade a different staff.

pic.alt: Location to upgrade Staff of Ice

step.title: Gather the raw energy into the Amulet
step.description: Go to the Dark Aether Nexus and switch the Staff of Ice to its alt fire. Use the Staff's Healing Shot to charge the crystal at the Vermin Monolith. Interact to pick up the energy.

step.title: Refine the raw energy
step.description: Go to the Vermin Altar in the Dig Site (Blue Gateway) and interact to place the energy. This will start a lockdown and spawn a ton of Vermin. Survive and kill Vermin until the lockdown finishes.

pic.alt: Vermin Altar to place the energy
Swarms of Vermin in the lockdown

step.title: Return the refined energy
step.description: Interact to gather the refined energy into the Amulet. This will close the Blue Gateway until the energy is returned to the Monolith in the Dark Aether Nexus, by going through one of the other Gateways.

step.title: Gather the raw energy into the Amulet
step.description: Use the Staff's Healing Shot to charge the crystal at the Parasite Monolith. Interact to pick up the energy.

step.title: Refine the raw energy
step.description: Go to the Parasite Altar in the Shrine of the Hierophants (Yellow Gateway) and interact to place the energy. This will start a lockdown with Parasites and zombies. Kill the purple glowing Parasites so they drop an energy orb. Walk up to the energy to pick it up, then walk back to the Altar to return the energy. Repeat until the lockdown is finished.

pic.alt: Parasite Altar to place the energy
Energy orb to bring to the Altar

step.title: Return the refined energy
step.description: Interact to gather the refined energy into the Amulet. This will close the Yellow Gateway until the energy is returned to the Monolith in the Dark Aether Nexus, by going through one of the other Gateways.

step.title: Gather the raw energy into the Amulet
step.description: Use the Staff's Healing Shot to charge the crystal at the Doppelghast Monolith. Interact to pick up the energy.

step.title: Refine the raw energy
step.description: Go to the Doppelghast Altar in the Ossuary (Green Gateway) and interact to place the energy. This will start a lockdown with Doppelghasts and zombies. There will also be purple circles and spinning lasers on the ground that will deal damage if you step on them. Survive and kill Doppelghasts until the lockdown finishes.

pic.alt: Doppelghast Altar to place the energy
Purple circles and lasers to avoid

step.title: Return the refined energy
step.description: Interact to gather the refined energy into the Amulet. This will close the Green Gateway until the energy is returned to the Monolith in the Dark Aether Nexus, by going through one of the other Gateways.

step.title: Gather the raw energy into the Amulet
step.description: Use the Staff's Healing Shot to charge the crystal at the Amalgam Monolith. Interact to pick up the energy.

step.title: Refine the raw energy
step.description: Go to the Amalgam Altar in the Deep Excavation (Red Gateway) and interact to place the energy. This will start a lockdown with one Amalgam and some zombies. Occasionally, the Amalgam will connect to zombies and will be immune from damage until the connected zombies are killed. Kill the Amalgam to finish the lockdown.

pic.alt: Amalgam Altar to place the energy

step.title: Return the refined energy
step.description: Interact to gather the refined energy into the Amulet. This will close the Red Gateway until the energy is returned to the Monolith in the Dark Aether Nexus, by going through one of the other Gateways.

subsections.description: You cannot leave the boss fight until it's done. Make sure you have perks, armor, strong weapons, and anything else you want to bring.

step.title: Activate the pedestal
step.description: Interact on the pedestal in the Dark Aether Nexus to open the bridge to the boss fight arena. Then, interact on the Sentinel Artifact to start the Final Encounter.

pic.alt: Pedestal location being powered by all 4 completed rituals
Sentinel Artifact to start boss fight

step.title: Phase 1
step.description: The Sentinel Artifact has 9 health stages that must be depleted to win the fight, and 1 health stage will be lost each time a Sentinel Artifact is broken. The artifact will start by rotating in a circle and shooting a deadly laser. It will also slowly move up and down to hit both levels of the arena. Eventually, it will turn purple for a short period of time, where it can be damaged (this will not be indicated on the boss bar until it breaks). Each time an artifact is broken, another one will join the artifact to spin around with an additional laser. All of the artifacts will turn purple at the same time, and it is possible to break multiple artifacts during this time to reduce multiple health stages. After the 4th artifact is broken, the fight will continue to Phase 2.

pic.alt: Max Ammo after an artifact is broken

step.title: Phase 2
step.description: During this phase, the 4 previously broken artifacts will remain spinning and shooting lasers, but can no longer be broken. The next 4 artifacts must be broken one at a time, and will spawn attached to an enemy. Kill the enemy holding the artifact, then quickly break the artifact before it goes away. If the artifact vanishes before it's broken, it will respawn on a new enemy. The artifact will be carried by a Heavy Zombie, Doppelghast, Shock Mimic, and Amalgam. After these 4 artifacts have been broken, the fight will continue to the final phase.

pic.alt: Enemy empowered by the Sentinel Artifact
Artifact to break after being dropped

step.title: Phase 3
step.description: For the final phase, the 8 previously broken artifacts will all shoot a laser at the 9th and final artifact. After a brief animation, the final artifact will float up to a wall where it can be broken. Finish off the Sentinel Artifact before it destroys you. If it isn't broken quick enough, the game will end. When done successfully, the artifact will float down to the center of the arena, where it can be picked up.

pic.alt: Final artifact being powered by the first 8
Final artifact to break before it ends the game

step.title: Retrieve the Sentinel Artifact
step.description: Interact on the Sentinel Artifact to complete the main quest and play a cutscene.

subsections.description: Interact with 3 Mister Peeks headphones.

pic.alt: Location 1 - near Speed Cola, to the right of the Green Gateway
Location 2 - in the Dark Aether Nexus, between the Red and Yellow Gateways

subsections.description: Complete 2 lockdowns to unlock a free Gold Armor Vest wall-buy in the Dig Site. Gold Armor holds 3 plates and regenerates on its own.

step.title: Collect 2 statue heads
step.description: There are 2 crates in the Dark Aether Nexus that can be broken by repeatedly meleeing them. Each crate contains a statue head that can be interacted to pick up.

pic.alt: Crate 2 - to the left of the Green Gateway

step.title: Place the statue heads
step.description: There are 2 statues with missing heads in the Dig Site. Interact on each statue to place the heads.

step.title: Lockdowns
step.description: There are 2 lockdowns to do (one per statue). In each lockdown, there is a heavy red fog, and you are limited to 1 hp for the entire fight, but armor works as normal. Kill all the Doppelghasts and Shock Mimics to finish the lockdown, or leave the area to cancel. Interact on a statue to start the blood sacrifice. After a successful lockdown, the statue will spew blood. When both are complete, the armor wall-buy will appear by the PaP location.

subsections.description: With the Death Perception perk active, digging with a shovel has a chance to spawn an Ancient Gem. Collect 3 Ancient Gems and offer them to a statue by Death Perception. This will spawn multiple Doppelghasts to kill. After all the Doppelghasts are killed, return to where the Ancient Gems were offered for a free Ray Gun.

subsections.header: Flying Rocks (Free Aetherium Crystal and Cryo Freeze)
subsections.description: Each time you enter the Dark Aether Nexus, one of the floating rocks will spark for a brief time. Shoot the rock that sparked to start a short timer where multiple rocks will fly around in circles. If all the rocks are shot within a short enough time, a Raw Aetherium Crystal and a Cryo Freeze Ammo Mod will drop in front of the Ice Staff Altar.
In the Dark Aether Nexus, there are 2 waterfalls that can be frozen using Cryo Freeze or the Staff of Ice. Freeze both waterfalls to spawn a free Aether Tool.

pic.alt: Waterfall 2 - between the Green and Red Gateways

subsections.header: Hidden Pots (Free Self-Revive and Light Mend)
subsections.description: There are 10 pots around the map that can be broken by shooting them. Breaking all 10 pots will spawn a Self-Revive Kit and a Light Mend Ammo Mod.

pic.alt: Location 1 - at the Dig Site, above the Rampage Inducer
Location 2 - at the Dig Site, above the door leading to Deadshot Daiquiri
Location 3 - at the Dig Site, above the Blue Gateway
Location 4 - near Deadshot Daiquiri, through the barrier by the Mystery Box location
Location 5 - between Deadshot Daiquiri and Speed Cola, above a doorway
Location 6 - near Death Perception, above the doorway leading to Stamin-Up
Location 7 - above Stamin-Up and to the right
Location 8 - above the Red Gateway and to the left
Location 9 - looking up from the Red Gateway, in the hole letting sunlight in
Location 10 - to the left of Quick Revive, on the stone wall

subsections.description: There are 9 statues on a wall by Death Perception, and all 9 must be lit up to drop some loot, including a Brain Rot Ammo Mod. Shoot the correct statue in the head to light it up, and it will remain lit for a short time. The correct order can be seen by shooting the fallen 10th statue in the head. Shooting the wrong statue will not reset the sequence, so you can quickly try shooting multiple statues until they all light up.

pic.alt: Fallen statue to see the correct order
Loot, including Brain Rot Ammo Mod

subsections.description: There are 6 stone bowls by the doorways around Speed Cola, and they can be lit using Napalm Burst or Molotovs. Each lit bowl will drop a Molotov, and after the 6th is lit, a Random Perk power-up will spawn. If all 6 are not lit within the time limit, the flames will go out, and this can be used to get unlimited Molotovs.
In the Dig Site, shoot 2 generators with Dead Wire to energize them. This will spawn a Full Power power-up and other loot.

pic.alt: Generator 2 - down the stairs from the armor wall-buy and to the left of another staircase

subsections.description: There are 4 skulls around Speed Cola with an X on them. Using Brain Rot, quickly shoot all 4 skulls in the correct order. This will spawn several Brain Rot zombies.

pic.alt: Skull 1 - in the room with the 2 doorways with traps, to the right of the door leading up towards Deadshot Daiquiri
Skull 2 - on the right side stairway with the trap, when facing Speed Cola
Skull 3 - in the center of the Green Gateway room
Skull 4 - by the Doppelghast Altar in the Speed Cola room

subsections.description: There are 3 possible spawns for the statue that causes the jumpscare. Aim down sight while looking at the statue, and it will turn to face you with red eyes. After looking away, you will hear whispering voices and the statue will disappear. The jumpscare will trigger once randomly when picking up loot. After the jumpscare has been triggered, the statue will reappear at any of the 3 locations, and can be repeated unlimited times.

pic.alt: Location 1 - to the right of Deadshot Daiquiri, through the barrier
Location 2 - near Deadshot Daiquiri, through the barrier by the Mystery Box location

sections.description: There are 8 hidden power-ups around the map that can be shot or exploded to collect.

pic.alt: Through the Red Gateway, in a hole in the wall near the door to Stamin-Up
In the Dark Aether Nexus, between the Green and Red Gateways
In the Dark Aether Nexus, between the Blue and Green Gateways
To the right of Speed Cola, in a hole in the wall
To the right of Stamin-Up, in a barrier
To the left of Quick Revive, in a hole seen from the stairs leading up towards the Red Gateway
Near Deadshot Daiquiri, through the barrier by the Mystery Box location, on top of a rock far into the cave

subsections.description: Spawns after all 7 other hidden power-ups have been collected.

pic.alt: At the Dig Site, in some fire above the wall between PhD Flopper and the Rampage Inducer
